intro: Sinosenecio chienii, commonly known as the Chinese Senecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has a mat-forming habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms during the summer months. Sinosenecio chienii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
